TopicTitle: Custom KSP Mission Flags and artwork precut to build your own!

Articles.Content:
I hope I'm doing this right!

I have been playing KSP for about 4 months or so and have always messed around with paint and photo software so i decided to make some flags for my game. I wanted to post them for anybody to use, as well as the images (cut outs with no backgrounds for easy layering) so that others may use to make there own. It is a really simple process to make flags and can be done with using just Paint.net or like myself use a combination of Paint.net, Art Rage , and Adobe elements 10. I am new to posting on forums ( just never really did anything but read them). So please give me some feedback if you know of a better way of posting and submitting files than what i will be using. Happy creating!

Side Note: If your wondering why there are files with "(NB)" in the file name it is because these templates have NO BACKGROUND for easy blending and layering.

http://www./download/an5zu5jkpilrdiq/Custom_KSP_Flags(2).zip

Edited July 11, 2013 by Dungchunker
Added Download Link

You can always upload them to SpacePort as flag packs. You also have this option: upload the flag and each art asset used to imgur.com and post the gallery here. Easy way to display everything and keep things simple. I'd suggest storing each of the assets as transparent background .PNGs. Easiest way for others to use the assets.

Warm Regards,

Joe

I am using Mediafire (obviously) and google for uploading pics to currently but will look into imgur.com. Also all the templates in the download are already transparent backgrounds and .png. The only few that are not are the full sized flattened flags before they were re-sized to 256x160 for use in the game, so that people can change those to there liking as well. Thanks for the feed back. Joe
